title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program for health professionals to serve in care scarcity areas for at least 2 years. Eligibility requires submitting an application. The Loan Repayment Program requires individuals to submit an application and sign a contract to participate. Approval is needed to become a participant in the program. Individuals must submit an application and sign a contract to participate in the Loan Repayment Program. Approval from the Secretary is required for the application and contract acceptance. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary studies background. The Secretary gives preference to applicants with interdisciplinary studies background when awarding contracts under this section. The Secretary also determines frontline care scarcity areas for contract recipients, giving preference to areas with demonstrated programs. The Secretary determines frontline care scarcity areas for contract recipients under this section, giving preference to areas with interdisciplinary health care programs or plans. Participants in the Loan Repayment Program are promptly notified upon approval. The Secretary notifies individuals promptly upon approving their participation in the Loan Repayment Program, which involves a written contract for student loan repayment. The Secretary provides student loan repayment for a determined period to pay off debts incurred during the study. The individual must accept the repayment and provide frontline care services for a specified full-time period. The individual must accept student loan repayment and provide frontline care services for a minimum of 2 years at a healthcare facility in a scarcity area. The financial obligations of the United States and the individual are contingent on funds being appropriated for loan repayment. The individual's obligation for student loan repayment is contingent upon funds being appropriated. The United States is entitled to damages for breach of contract, and the Secretary determines the rights and liabilities of both parties. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment to recruit healthcare providers into the program. Payments are made directly to the loan provider. The Secretary may pay a sufficient amount to recruit healthcare providers into the loan repayment program. Payments can be made directly to the loan provider on behalf of the individual. If an individual breaches the contract by not fulfilling their service obligation, the United States can recover an amount from the individual. If an individual breaches a written contract by failing to start or complete their service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid to the individual, plus interest. The term 'frontline care scarcity area' refers to an area, population group, or facility in need of healthcare providers. The term 'frontline care scarcity area' refers to an area, population group, or facility designated as a health professional shortage area or having a shortage of frontline care services. Frontline care services include health care services in general surgery and optometry. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of 'frontline care services' in various healthcare fields. It highlights the shortage of such services in specific areas. The curr_chunk discusses the provision of frontline care services in various healthcare fields such as occupational therapy, pediatrics, respiratory therapy, medical technology, otolaryngology, and radiologic technology by a range of healthcare professionals. The curr_chunk outlines the authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2010 to 2013 to support frontline care services provided by healthcare professionals in various fields. Authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2010 to 2016 for frontline care services by healthcare professionals, with increasing amounts allocated each year and adjustments based on the average percentage increase in health professions education costs. For fiscal year 2016 and onwards, the allocated amount will be adjusted based on the average increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary must start implementing the loan repayment program within 180 days of this section's enactment.
